abstract:
We introduce a new type of timing attack which enables the factorization of an RSA-modulus if the exponentiation with the
secret exponent uses the Chinese Remainder Theorem and Montgomeryâ€™s algorithm. Its standard variant assumes that both exponentiations
are carried out with a simple square and multiply algorithm. However, although its effciency decreases, our attack can also
be adapted to more advanced exponentiation algorithms. The previously known timing attacks do not work if the Chinese Remainder
Theorem is used.
